Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
ruling: Q: For this card's effect, if I do not reveal both a card with [Greymon] in its name and a card with [Omnimon] in its name, does that mean I don't get to add them to my hand?

cards.name: Gaossmon
cards.effect1:
[Your Turn] Your other [Gaossmon] all get +3000 DP.
[Opponent's Turn] Your opponent can't reduce digivolution costs.
ruling: Q: What does this card's effect of [cannot reduce digivolution costs] mean exactly?

A: It is an effect that nullifies the effects that reduces the cost to digivolve such as <Digisorption>, or [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!], etc. Even if your opponent activates those effects, they are unable to reduce the cost to digivolve, and must pay the digivolution cost as written on the cards to digivolve.
Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use <Digisorption> of a card in my hand to reduce the digivolution cost?
A: No you cannot.
Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use effects of [Digivolve for X cost while ignoring the Digivolution requirements] like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] etc?
A: Yes you can, as the effects of cards like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] do not reduce the digivolution cost, but allows you to digivolve by paying a specified cost while ignoring digivolution requirements.
Q: My opponent has [BT5-008 Gaossmon], can I use <Digisorption> to suspend a Digimon even though the cost is not reduced?
A: Yes, you can still suspend a Digimon with <Digisorption> even though you can't reduce the digivolution cost.
Q: Can my opponent digivolve into [BT7-040 Rasenmon] for a lower digivolution cost if I have this card?
A: Yes, that card's effect does not "reduce" it "sets" the digivolution cost.

cards.name: Shoutmon

cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has <Blitz>, it gets +2000 DP.
ruling: Q: For this card's effect, if I do not reveal both a card with [Shoutmon] in its name and a card with <Blitz>, does that mean I don't get to add them to my hand?
A: No, if you only revealed either a Digimon card with [Shoutmon] in its name or a Digimon card with <Blitz>, you still add either of them to your hand.
Q: For this card's effect, if I revealed 2 [BT5-019 Shoutmon DX] from among the 5 revealed cards, can I add them both to my hand?
A: Yes, as [BT5-019 Shoutmon DX] can meet either condition of "Digimon card with [Shoutmon] in its name" and "Digimon card with <Blitz>, you can add them both to your hand.

Does this Digimon now get +4000 DP in total, or only +1000 DP from the last card trashed?

cards.name: Shoutmon DX
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] <Blitz> (If your opponent has 1 or more memory, this Digimon may attack).
[When Digivolving] You may place 1 red Digimon card from your hand at the top of this Digimon's digivolution cards. Then, for each [OmniShoutmon] or [ZeigGreymon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less.
ruling: Q: When I digivolve a Level 5 Digimon into this Digimon, can I put a Red Level 4 or below, or a Level 7 Digimon card from my hand to the top most digivolution cards card?
A: Yes, you can.

Q: I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to put a Level 3 Digimon card on the top of its digivolution cards. This Digimon then receives the effect of <De-Digivolve  1> and is trashed. What happens to this Digimon?
A: It becomes a Level 3 Digimon. The digivolution cards under this Digimon remain as they are, and their inherited effects can still activate.

Q: I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to put a Level 3 Digimon card on the top of its digivolution cards. This Digimon then receives the effect of <De-Digivolve  2>. How do I resolve this?

A: This card itself is trashed due to <De-Digivolve>, then this Digimon becomes a Level 3 Digimon. As <De-Digivolve> is unable to trash any further when the Digimon becomes Level 3, the <De-Digivolve> effect ends. The digivolution cards under this Digimon remain as they are, and their inherited effects can still activate.
Q: Since this card has 2 [When Digivolving] effects, if I choose to resolve <Blitz> first, does that mean I resolve the other [When Digivolving] effect after the attack from <Blitz> ends?

A: No, if you chose to resolve <Blitz> first, you will suspend this Digimon, and declare attack. The actual attack will only happen after all other [When Digivolving] effects have finished resolving. (See more in Attack Resolution)

Q: I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to put [BT5-017 ZeigGreymon] from my hand to the top of this Digimon's digivolution cards. I then activate <Blitz> to attack. Does [ZeigGreymon]'s inherited effect then allow me to attack my opponent's unsuspended Digimon?
A: Yes, you can attack your opponent's unsuspended Digimon due to [ZeigGreymon]'s inherited effect.
Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete Digimon even if I don't place a card on its digivolution cards?
A: Yes, you can still delete Digimon without doing the first part of the [When Digivolving].
Q: Can I attempt to delete less Digimon than the number of [ZeigGreymon] or [OmniShoutmon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards?
A: No, if there is a valid target and you have not deleted equal to the number of [ZeigGreymon] or [OmniShoutmon] in its digivolution cards you must delete that target.

Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play, my Digimon with <Security Attack +1> attacks my opponent Player, and the Security Check reveals a [BT1-101 Howling Crusher], and its [Security] effect removed all of my attacking Digimon's digivolution cards. Is that attack now interrupted and ends?
A: No, as the digivolution cards are lost after the declaration of attack, this card's effect does not interrupt and stop the attack from continuing.

ruling: Q: If I digivolve [BT5-056 Rafflesimon] on top of another [BT5-056 Rafflesimon]. Can I use the (Once Per Turn) effect of the new Rafflesimon if the old Rafflesimon used it before?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Rosemon
cards.effect1:
[Main] <Digi-Burst 3> (You may trash 3 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to activate the effect below)
・All of your Digimon with <Digi-Burst> gain <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.
ruling: Q: If after using this card's <Digi-Burst> effect, one of my Digimon without <Digi-Burst> becomes a Digimon with <Digi-Burst>, does that Digimon gain <Security Attack +1>?
A: Yes, this effect is applied as a Global Effect. If it satisfies the condition afterwards, it gains <Security Attack +1>.
Q: If after using this card's <Digi-Burst> effect, one of my Digimon with <Digi-Burst> becomes a Digimon without <Digi-Burst>, does that Digimon keep the <Security Attack +1>?
A: No, this effect is applied as a Global Effect. So if it no longer satisfies the condition then it no longer has the <Security Attack +1>.
Q: If after using this card's <Digi-Burst> effect, this card leaves the battle area does the <Security Attack +1> continue being applied?
A: Yes, as it has already resolved and applied a Global effect, the Global effect continues applying even after Rosemon leaves the battle area.

cards.name: Argomon
cards.effect1:
<Digisorption -2> (When one of your Digimon digivolves into this card from your hand, you may suspend 1 of your Digimon to reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 2).
[When Digivolving] Suspend all of your opponent's Tamers.
[All Turns] Your opponent's Tamers don't unsuspend.

cards.name: Keramon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal 5 cards from the top of your deck. Add 1 Digimon card with [Unidentified] in its type and/or 1 [Arata Sanada] card among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
ruling: Q: For this card's effect, if I do not reveal an [Unidentified] Type Digimon card and a [Arata Sanada], does that mean I don't get to add them to my hand?
A: No, if you only revealed either an [Unidentified] Type Digimon card or a [Arata Sanada], you still add them to your hand.

cards.name: Monitamon
cards.effect1:
[On Play] Look at the top card of your deck.
[On Deletion] Reveal 3 cards from the top of your deck. You may play 1 [Monitamon] among them without paying its memory cost. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
ruling: Q: For this card's [On Play] effect, what do I do with the top 1 card of my deck after confirming it?
A: Return that card face down back to the top of your deck.

cards.name: Commandramon
cards.effect1: <Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead)

cards.name: Mekanorimon
cards.effect1:
<Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead) 
[Your Turn] This Digimon can't attack. 
[Opponent's Turn] When this Digimon deletes an opponent's Digimon in battle and survives, unsuspend it.

cards.name: Kurisarimon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] If you don't have an [Arata Sanada] card in play, you may play one from your hand without paying its memory cost.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] All of your other Digimon with the same name as this Digimon gain <Rush> (This Digimon can attack the turn it comes into play).
ruling: Q: If a Digimon that has <Rush> from this card's effect is digivolved into a Digimon with a different name, does that mean that Digimon cannot attack anymore on the turn it was played?
A: Yes, since that Digimon is now a different name, it has lost <Rush> and cannot attack anymore.
Q: If I play [BT5-063 Kurisarimon] this turn, and then digivolve it into a new Digimon. Does the Digimon on top of Kurisarimon gain <Rush>?
A: No, it does not. It is only other Digimon that share a name that gain <Rush>.

cards.name: BlackGaogamon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has <Reboot>, it gains <Jamming> (This Digimon can't be deleted in battles against Security Digimon).

cards.name: Shademon
cards.effect1:
[Security] At the end of the battle, play this card without paying its memory cost.
<Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
 [Your Turn] This Digimon can't attack.
ruling: Q: Is a Digimon Played by this card's effect also treated as a Security Digimon in the Battle Area?
A: No, from the point of time when it's Played, it is treated as a normal Digimon.
Q: For this card's effect, can the Digimon be Played even if it lost the battle against the attacking Digimon as a Security Digimon?
A: Yes, regardless of the outcome of the battle, it is played after the battle ends.
Q: For this card's effect, if this was revealed from a Check, but the attacking Digimon still has remaining checks left, is this Digimon Played first, or do the remaining checks finish first?
A: The timing to Play this Digimon is after its battle with the attacking Digimon. So it is played before the remaining checks happen.

cards.name: Infermon
cards.effect1: Your [Keramon] can digivolve into this card in your hand for a memory cost of 4, ignoring this card's digivolution requirements.
cards.effect2: [On Deletion] You may play 1 [Diaboromon] Token without paying its memory cost. (Diaboromon Tokens are level 6 white Digimon with a memory cost of 14, 3000 DP, and are Mega form, Unidentified type, and Unknown attribute.)
ruling: Q: Can I digivolve my [Keramon] in my Breeding Area into this card?
A: No, your [Keramon] in your Breeding Area cannot digivolve into this card with this card's effect.
Q: What is a [Token]?

A: Played by an effect, it is a special card that is treated like any other Digimon or Tamer With this card's effect, a Token that is treated a s Digimon named [Diaboromon] is played. For more rule details on Tokens, please check the Rule Manual.

cards.name: BlackMachGaogamon
cards.jpname: ブラッマッハガオガモン
cards.effect1: <Reboot> (Unsuspend this Digimon during your opponent's unsuspend phase)
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has <Reboot>, it gets +2000 DP.

cards.name: BlackWarGreymon
cards.jpname: ブラックウォーグレイモン
cards.effect1:
<Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
<Reboot> (Unsuspend this Digimon during your opponent's unsuspend phase).

cards.name: MetalGarurumon
cards.effect1:
<Reboot> (Unsuspend this Digimon during your opponent's unsuspend phase).
[When Digivolving] <Digi-Burst 2> (You may trash 2 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to activate the effect below).
・Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less. If no Digimon was deleted by this effect, trash the top card of your opponent's security stack.
ruling: Q: What does this card's <Digi-Burst> effect of "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less. If no Digimon was deleted by this effect..." mean exactly?

A: At the point of time when you use this <Digi-Burst>,  your opponent does not have any Digimon that are 6 cost or Below, or if there are no Digimon that can be deleted by this effect, It refers to a situation where your opponent does not have a Digimon that can be deleted by this effect.
Q: When I use this card's <Digi-Burst>, and my opponent has a 6 cost or below Digimon, can I choose not to delete that Digimon to trash the top 1 card of my oppponent's Security?

A: No, when you use this card's <Digi-Burst>, if there is a valid target of [opponen'ts Digimon with 6 Play cost or below], you must delete it. You cannot choose not to activate an effect if there is a valid target.

Q: If my opponent has a 6 cost or below Digimon with the effect [This Digimon cannot be deleted by opponent's effects], and another Digimon without that effect, when I use this card's <Digi-Burst>, can I purposely choose the Digimon that has the effect of [This Digimon cannot be deleted by opponent's effect] to trash the top 1 card of my opponent's Security?
A: Yes, as it was a valid target of 6 cost or below Digimon, you can target it with this effect, then fail to delete it because of its effect of [cannot be deleted by opponent's effects].
Q: If I target my opponent's Digimon for deletion, but it activates an effect that prevents it. Do I still get to trash a card from security?
A: Yes, no Digimon was deleted by this effect so you will trash the top card of your opponent's Security.

cards.name: Guilmon
cards.effect1: [On Deletion] When this card was deleted by an effect, gain 1 memory.
ruling: Q: This Digimon is deleted by being put to 0 DP by my opponent's effects and is deleted. Does this card's [On Deletion] effect activate?
A: No, as this card's condition is "has been deleted by an effect" and a Digimon being deleted by having 0 DP is a game rule, and not an effect, it does not activate.
Q: This Digimon is deleted, but not by an effect. Does its [On Deletion] effect trigger?
A: No, the effect does not trigger. This effect behaves the same way as an effect that reads "When this Digimon is deleted by an effect".

cards.name: Fake Agumon Expert
cards.effect1: [On Deletion]  You may return 1 level 3 Digimon card with an [On Deletion] effect other than [Fake Agumon Expert], from your trash to your hand.
ruling: Q: For this card's effect, can I return a Level 3 Digimon card that has a [On Deletion] inherited effect to my hand?
A: No, you cannot.
Q: If this Digimon is deleted at the same time as another Digimon that gained an [On Deletion] effect from its digivolution cards. Can I add that Digimon card to hand?
A: No, even though the Digimon has [On Deletion], the Digimon card does not have [On Deletion], so it cannot be returned.

cards.name: Troopmon
cards.effect1: [On Deletion] You may play 1 [Troopmon] from your hand without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Musyamon
cards.effect1: <Jamming> (This Digimon can't be deleted in battles against Security Digimon)

cards.name: BlackGrowlmon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your other Digimon is deleted, this Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.

cards.name: Jokermon
cards.effect1: [On Deletion] You may play 1 level 3 purple Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost. Any [On Play] effects on Digimon played with this effect don't activate.

cards.name: BlackWarGrowlmon
cards.jpname: ブラックメガログラウモン
cards.effect1:
[Main] <Digi-Burst 3> (You may trash 3 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to activate the effect below).
・ You may play 1 level 3 purple Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost. Any [On Play] effects on Digimon played with this effect don't activate.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) You may delete 1 of your other Digimon to unsuspend this Digimon.

cards.name: Zanbamon
cards.effect1: <Retaliation> (When this Digimon is deleted after losing a battle, delete the Digimon it was battling).

cards.name: ChaosGallantmon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] You may delete 1 of your other Digimon to delete 1 of your opponent's level 5 or lower Digimon.
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your other Digimon is deleted, you may play 1 level 3 purple Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost. Any [On Play] effects on Digimon played with this effect don't activate.

cards.name: Tactimon
cards.effect1:
[When Attacking] Activate 1 of the effects below. If you have no other Digimon in play, activate all of the effects below instead.
・Gain 1 memory.
・This Digimon gets +2000 DP for the turn.
・Delete up to 3 of your opponent's level 3 Digimon.
ruling: Q: For this card's effect, when I have another Digimon, can I choose which of the 3 effects to activate?
A: Yes, that's right.
Q: When I have no other Digimon, in which order do I activate the 3 effects?
A: The player can choose which order to activate them in.

cards.name: Megidramon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] Both players trash the top 5 cards of their decks.
[On Deletion] If you have a Tamer in play, you may play 1 level 6 Digimon card with [Gallantmon] in its name from your hand or trash without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Diaboromon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] You may play 1 [Diaboromon] Token without paying its memory cost. (Diaboromon Tokens are level 6 white Digimon with a memory cost of 14, 3000 DP, and are Mega form, Unidentified type, and Unknown attribute.)
ruling: Q: What is a [Token]?

A:  ◼ Played by an effect, it is a special card that is treated like any other Digimon or Tamer. ◼ With this card's effect, a Token that is treated a s Digimon named [Diaboromon] is played. ◼ For more rule details on Tokens, please check the Rule Manual.

cards.name: Armageddemon
cards.effect1:
When playing this card from your hand, you may delete 1 of your [Diaboromon] to reduce this card's play cost by 12.
<Rush> (This Digimon can attack the turn it comes into play).
[All Turns] The [When Digivolving] effects on level 7 Digimon don't activate.
ruling: Q: When I play this card, can I delete a [Diaboromon Token to reduce this card's Play cost by 12 with this card's effect?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: Does this card's effect prevent the effect from triggering or activating?
A: The effect does not stop the effect from triggering, it only prevents the player from activating the triggered effect. (See more in Effect Resolution)
Q: My opponent has an effect with double conditions such as [When Attacking][When Digivolving]. Can the effect still activate if it attacks?
A: Yes, this effect only prevents effects that triggered from a [When Digivolving] timing from activating.

cards.name: Omnimon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] <Blitz> (If your opponent has 1 or more memory, this Digimon may attack).
[When Digivolving] Unsuspend this Digimon.
[All Turns] When an opponent's effect would delete this Digimon or return it to its owner's hand or deck, you may prevent it from leaving play by trashing a level 6 Digimon card in this card's digivolution cards.
ruling: Q: When digivolving into this card, can I choose to resolve <Blitz> first to attack, then unsuspend this Digimon?

A: Yes, if you choose to resolve the effects of <Blitz> first, you will suspend this Digimon and declare attack, then unsuspend this Digimon. The attack itself only happens after any other effects of the same timing are resolved
Q: When I use this Digimon's [All Turns] effect, can I use my other Digimon's [When a Digimon is deleted] effects?
A: No, as this card's [All Turns] effects nullifies the effect of it being deleted or returned to hand or deck, it is not treated to have been deleted.
Q: This Digimon deletes a Digimon with <Retaliation> in battle while it has [BT3-016 Durandamon] in its digivolution cards. Does the Digimon's security check from <Piercing> still happen?
A: Yes, <Piercing> was resolved and as the Digimon is still in play, it can perform security checks.
Q: If my opponent uses this card's effect to trash a digivolution card. Can I use [BT2-085 Joe Kido]'s effect?
A: Yes, you can.

Q: This Digimon deletes a Digimon in battle that has 2 copies of the <Retaliation> effect from different sources. If this Digimon prevents one of the effects by trashing a level 6, can the other still delete it?
A: Yes, after Omnimon prevents the first Retaliation effect. The second Retaliation effect can be activated by the opponent to try and delete it again.

cards.name: Omnimon Zwart
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] Trash the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, you may play up to 2 black or purple Digimon cards with play costs of 8 or less from your trash without paying their memory costs.
[When Attacking] You may return 1 level 6 Digimon card in this Digimon's digivolution cards to its owner's hand to delete 1 of your opponent's unsuspended Digimon with a play cost of 12 or less.
ruling: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I choose any 2 Purple or Black Digimon card with Play cost of 8 or less in my Trash even if they were not trashed by this effect?
A: Yes, you can Play any Purple or Black Digimon card with Play cost of 8 or less that were originally already in your Trash.
Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to play 1 Black Digimon and 1 Purple Digimon?
A: Yes, you can choose 1 Black Digimon and 1 Purple Digimon to play with this effect.

cards.name: Sora Takenouchi & Joe Kido
cards.effect1:
[Start of Your Turn] If your opponent has a digimon with no digivolution cards, gain 2 memory.
[Your Turn] When you attack with a blue Digimon, you may suspend this Tamer to trash up to 2 digivolution cards from the bottom of 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply even if my opponent only has 1 Digimon with no digivolution cards and the rest of their Digimon have digivolution cards?
A: Yes, it does.
Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?
A: No, it doesn't check Digimon in the breeding area.
Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply when my opponent doesn't have any Digimon in their battle area?
A: No, it doesn't. Your opponent has to have a Digimon in their battle area for it to activate.
Q: When my blue Digimon attacks, can I suspend this Tamer even if my opponent has no Digimon in the battle area?
A: Yes, it is a "Do <X> to <Y> effect. As such, it follows the rules detailed in the Detailed Rules. (Found in Effect Resolution/Related Information#Costs)

cards.name: Izzy Izumi & Mimi Tachikawa
cards.jpname: 泉光子郎 & 太刀川ミミ
cards.effect1:
[Start of Your Turn]  If your opponent has a suspended Digimon in play, gain 2 memory.
[Your Turn] When you attack with a level 5 green Digimon, you may suspend this Tamer to reveal 3 cards from the top of your deck. You may digivolve 1 green level 6 Digimon card among them onto the attacking Digimon without paying its memory cost. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: If my opponent has a suspended Digimon with <Reboot>, and becomes Active in my Unsuspend Phase, does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect activate?
A: Yes, it does. [Start of Your Turn] effects are activated before Digimon are unsuspended in the Unsuspend Phase.
Q: For this card's [Your Turn] effect, if my Green Level 5 Digimon attacks and reveals a Green Level 6 Digimon, must I digivolve into that Digimon?
A: No, as the effect says "you may", you can choose not to digivolve it.
Q: For this card's [Your Turn] effect, if 2 or more Green Level 6 Digimon are revealed, can I choose which card to digivolve into?
A: Yes, you can choose.
Q: When my Digimon attacks and digivolves usinig this card's [Your Turn] effect, do I Draw 1 from the Digivolution Bonus?
A: Yes, you do.
Q: For this card's [Your Turn] effect, if I revealed a non-Green Level 6 Digimon, can I digivolve into them?
A: No, you cannot.
Q: If I have 2 of this Tamer, and my Green Level 5 Digimon attacks, can I suspended both Tamers and reveal the top 6 cards of my deck to choose a card to digivolve into?

A: Although you can activate both Tamer's effect in 1 attack, you are to resolve the 2 Tamer's effect 1 by 1  and not at the same time. First you suspend the 1st Tamer, reveal the top 3 cards of your deck, and choose a card to digivolve into. After that, you can choose to activate the 2nd Tamer's effect or not. If you digivolved into a Green Level 6 Digimon from the 1st Tamer's effect, even if the 2nd Tamer's effect reveals a Green Level 6 Digimon, you cannot digivolve your now Level 6 Digimon into the revealed Green Level 6 Digimon unless it fulfills the digivolution requirement (Like [BT5-056 Rafflesimon] etc).
Q: If the Level 6 Digimon I digivolve into with this card's [Your Turn] effect has a [When Digivolving] effect, at what timing do they activate>?

A: It activates immediately after you draw the bonus card for digivolving. Even if there are other [When Attacking] or "When one of your Digimon attacks" effects, the [When Digivolving] effect activates first as a newly triggered effect. (See more in Effect Resolution)
Q: If the Level 6 Digimon I digivolve into with this card's [Your Turn] effect has a [When Attacking] effect, does that effect activate?
A: No, as it is already passed timing for [When Attacking] effects to activate, they do not activate,.

cards.name: Arata Sanada
cards.effect1:
[Start of Your Turn] If a Digimon card with [Unidentified] in its type is in your trash, gain 1 memory.
[Your Turn] When one of your Digimon digivolves into [Diaboromon], you may suspend this Tamer to play 1 [Diaboromon] Token without paying its memory cost. (Diaboromon Tokens are level 6 white Digimon with a memory cost of 14, 3000 DP, and are Mega form, Unidentified type, and Unknown attribute.)
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: What is a [Token]?

A:  ◼ Played by an effect, it is a special card that is treated like any other Digimon or Tamer. ◼ With this card's effect, a Token that is treated a s Digimon named [Diaboromon] is played. ◼ For more rule details on Tokens, please check the Rule Manual.

cards.name: Takumi Aiba
cards.effect1:
[Your Turn]  When one of your Digimon digivolves, you may suspend this Tamer to trigger <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
[All Turns] All level 3 Digimon gain "[When Attacking] Lose 1 memory."
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also give my own Level 3 Digimon the effect of "[When Attacking] Memory -1"?
A: Yes, it gives your own Digimon the effect as well.
Q: If there are 2 of this Tamer in play, when a Level 3 Digimon attacks, does it become Memory -2?
A: Yes, as both effects are activated separately, there will be a total of Memory -2.
Q: I digivolve a Digimon in my breeding area. Can I use this Tamer's effect to <Draw 1>?
A: No, digivolving Digimon in your breeding area doesn't trigger the effect to <Draw 1>.
Q: I digivolve my Red Tamer into a Digimon with the effect of [BT4-011 Agunimon]. Can I suspend this card to <Draw 1>?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Nokia Shiramine
cards.effect1:
[On Play] You may play 1 [Agumon] or [Gabumon] from your hand without paying its memory cost.
[Main] When one of your Digimon would digivolve into a Digimon card in your hand with [Omnimon], [Greymon], or [Garurumon] in its name (other than [DoruGreymon], [BurningGreymon], [DexDoruGreymon], or [KendoGarurumon]), you may suspend this Tamer to reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 1.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: I digivolve a Digimon in my breeding area into a Digimon card with [Greymon], [Garurumon], or [Omnimon] in its name. Can I use this Tamer's effect to reduce the digivolution cost by 1?
A: No, digivolving Digimon in your breeding area doesn't trigger the effect that reduces digivolution cost by 1.
Q: Does the second effect of this Tamer stack if there are multiple copies in play in my battle area?
A: Yes, each copy of this Tamer may be be suspended to reduce the digivolution cost by 1 each.
Q: Why does this card have a [Main] effect?
A: The [Main] means you cannot use the effect outside of the main phase.
Q: Can I play [ToyAgumon] or [Agumon Expert] with this card's [On Play] effect?
A: No, [ST5-04 ToyAgumon] is not named [Agumon] or [Gabumon]. The effect to play a Digimon does not have "in its name" in the card text.

cards.name: Tai Kamiya & Matt Ishida
cards.jpname: 八神 太一 & 石田 ヤマト
cards.effect1:
[Start of Your Turn] If your opponent has a level 6 or higher Digimon in play, gain 2 memory.
[Your Turn] All of your Digimon with [Omnimon] in their name gain <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Rowdy Rocker
cards.effect1: [Main] You may place 1 red level 4 or lower Digimon card from your hand under 1 of your Digimon as its bottom digivolution card. If you do, trigger <Draw 2> (Draw 2 cards from your deck).
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: Can I put a Red Level 4 or less Digimon card from my hand under the digivolution cards of a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer?
A: Yes, you can.

Q: I put a Digimon card under a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer. That Digimon then receive the effect of <De-Digivolve> and becomes a Tamer card. What happens to the digivolution cards below the Tamer?

A: They remain in the digivolution cards. However as it is not a Digimon anymore, the inherited effects do not activate. If that Tamer digivolves into a Digimon again, the inherited effects will activate as per normal.
Q: Can I use this card to place a digivolution card underneath a Token?
A: No, you cannot.

cards.name: Transcendent Sword

cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this cards [Main] effect.

cards.name: Supreme Cannon

If you have a Digimon in play with [Omnimon], or [Garurumon] in its name (other than [KendoGarurumon]), return all of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less to their owners' hands instead. Trash all of the digivolution cards of those Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this cards [Main] effect.

cards.name: Absolute Blast

cards.effect1: [Main] Trash the bottom digivolution card of 1 of your opponent's Digimon. Then, return 1 of your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards to the bottom of its owner's deck.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: For this card's effect, can I choose a different Digimon to Return to Hand instead of the Digimon I chose to trash a digivolution card from?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Meteor Shower
cards.effect1: [Main] You may play 1 yellow Digimon card with [Starmon] in its name from your hand without paying its memory cost.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this cards [Main] effect.

cards.name: Spiral Masquerade
cards.jpname: スパイラルマスカレード
cards.effect1:
[Main] For each Digimon you have in play, activate the effect below.
・1 of your opponents Digimon gets -3000 DP for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: When I have 2 Digimon, can I use this card's effect of "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -3000 DP" twice on the same Digimon to give it -6000 DP?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Royal Nuts
cards.effect1: [Main] Reveal 5 cards from the top of your deck. Add 1 Digimon card with <Digisorption> among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: You Can't Actually Fly?
cards.effect1: [Main] Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. Then, if your opponent has a level 7 Digimon in play, trash the top card of their security stack.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: My opponent has a Level 7 Digimon, and has 0 Security cards. Do I win the game if I use this card?
A: No, in this case you just become unable to trash your opponent's Security Cards and you do not win the game.

cards.name: Wisselen
cards.effect1: [Main]  Up to 2 of your opponent's Digimon can't attack or block until the end of your opponent's next turn. Then, if you have a Digimon with <Digi-Burst> in play, gain 2 memory.
cards.effect2: [Security] Up to 2 of your opponent's Digimon can't attack until the end of the turn. Then, if you have a Digimon with <Digi-Burst> in play, gain 2 memory.

cards.name: A Blazing Storm of Metal!
cards.jpname: 熱く激しきメタルの嵐!!
cards.effect1: [Main] Until the end of your opponent's next turn, all of your Digimon with <Reboot> get +1000 DP and <Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
cards.effect2: [Security] Your opponent's Digimon can't attack players for the turn. Then, add this card to your hand.
ruling: Q: After my opponent activate this card's [Security] effect, my Digimon with <Piercing> attacks and deletes my opponent's Digimon in battle. Does a Security Check happen?
A: Yes, you can still attack Digimon, and Security Checks from <Piercing> still happen.

cards.name: Catastrophe Cannon
cards.jpname: カタストロフィーカノン
cards.effect1: [Main] Trigger <De-Digivolve  2> on 1 of your opponent's Digimon (Trash up to 2 cards from the top of one of your opponent's Digimon. If it has no digivolution cards, or becomes a level 3 Digimon, you can't trash any more cards). Then if you have a [Diaboromon] in play, you may play 1 [Diaboromon] Token without paying its memory cost. (Diaboromon Tokens are level 6 white Digimon with a memory cost of 14, 3000 DP, and are Mega form, Unidentified type, and Unknown attribute.)
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: My opponent has no Digimon I can target with <De-Digivolve  2>, can I still use this option to play a [Diaboromon Token]?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: If I only have a [Diaboromon Token] in my Battle Area, can I use this option to play a new [Diaboromon Token]?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Ultimate Flare
cards.jpname: アルティメットフレア
cards.effect1: [Main] Trigger <De-Digivolve  3> on 1 of your opponent's Digimon (Trash up to 3 cards from the top of one of your opponent's Digimon. If it has no digivolution cards, or becomes a level 3 Digimon, you can't trash any more cards). Then, delete all of your opponent's Digimon with play costs of 3 or less.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: My opponent has no Digimon that will be affected <De-Digivolve  3>, can I still use this option to delete all of my opponent's Digimon with Play cost of 3 or less?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Demonic Disaster
cards.jpname: デモンズディザスター
cards.effect1: [Main] You may delete 1 of your Digimon to unsuspend 1 of your purple Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security] You may play 1 level 3 purple Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost. Any [On Play] effects on Digimon played with this effect don't activate.

cards.name: Revive From the Darkness!
cards.effect1: [Main] Delete 1 of your purple Digimon. Then, you may play 1 level 5 or lower purple Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost. Any [On Play] effects on Digimon played with this effect don't activate.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: Using this card's effect, I played a Digimon with effects that says [When your other Digimon are deleted], does that effect activate since I deleted my 1 of my Digimon with this card?
A: No, as that Digimon is Played after the you already deleted your Digimon from this card's effect.
Q: If I don't have a Digimon to delete can I still play a level 5 or lower Purple Digimon from my trash?
A: Yes, you can. "Then," effects are independent of each other.

cards.name: Earth Shaker
cards.effect1: [Main] Delete 1 of your opponent's unsuspended level 4 Digimon and 1 of your opponent's unsuspended level 5 Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security] Activate this card's [Main] effect.
ruling: Q: Does this card's effect activate if my opponent does not have both a Level 4 and a Level 5 unsuspended Digimon?

A: Yes, even if your opponent does not have either a Level 4 or Level 5 unsuspended Digimon, the effect still activates. If your opponent has one or the other, you would do as much as you can and delete the Level 4 or Level 5 unsuspended Digimon level that your opponent does have.

cards.name: Mega Digimon Fusion!
cards.jpname: 究極合体デジモンへの融合！
cards.effect1: [Main] The next time one of your Digimon digivolves from level 6 to level 7 this turn, reduce the cost of the digivolution by 6. At the end of the turn, return the Digimon that digivolved with this effect to the bottom of its owner's deck. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Security]  Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: I activate [BT5-109 Mega Digimon Fusion!] and [BT3-105 Breath of the Gods] on a Digimon with <Reboot> then digivolve the Digimon with <Reboot> into a level 7 Digimon, does the level 7 Digimon return to the bottom of the deck at the end of the turn?
A: No, it does not return to the bottom of the deck because Breath of the Gods prevent it from happening.
Q: If I digivolve on top of a tamer using the effect of [BT7-112 Susanoomon], can I use this card's effect to reduce the memory cost?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: All Delete
cards.effect1: [Main] You may return 1 of your Digimon with [Omnimon] in its name to its owner's hand to delete all Digimon and Tamers. Trash all of the digivolution cards of the Digimon you returned with this effect.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: Does this card's effect also delete all of my Digimon and Tamers?
A: Yes, that's right.

cards.name: Omnimon X Anti-body
cards.effect1:
Your Digimon with [Omnimon] in its name can digivolve into this card in your hand for a memory cost of 3, ignoring this card's digivolution requirements.
[When Attacking] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP.
[Opponent's Turn] When your opponent's Digimon attacks, you may trash 2 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to end the attack.
ruling: Q: Can I digivolve my Digimon with [Omnimon] in its name that's in my Breeding Area into this card?
A: No, you cannot digivolve your Digimon with [Omnimon] in its name that's in your Breeding Area into this card with its effect.
Q: When I attack an opponent's Digimon, then uses this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect to delete the target of attack, what happens?
A: As the attack target is lost, the attack ends without battle.
Q: When this Digimon has <Piercing> and attacks an opponent's Digimon, then uses this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect to delete the target of attack, does a Securitiy Check from <Piercing> happen?
A: No, as you did not delete your opponent's Digimon in battle, the condition for <Piercing> is not fulfilled.
Q: My opponent attacks my Digimon with this Digimon, and uses its [When Attacking] effect to delete the target of attack. Can I still activate my other Digimon's <Blocker> to block that attack?
A: Yes, you can. In that scenario, a battle between this Digimon and the blocking Digimon will happen.
Q: Can I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end my opponent's Digimon's attack before their [When Attacking] effects activate?
A: No, this effect is a [Reaction] effect. So the opponent's [When Attacking] effects will be activated first. (See more in Attack Resolution)

Q: My opponent Digimon activates their [When Attacking] effect to delete another of their Digimon that has [On Deletion] effects, I then use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end that attack. Do those [On Deletion] effects activate?
A: Yes, the [On Deletion] effect activates immediately and before the [Reaction] step. (See more in Attack Resolution and Effect Resolution)
Q: When my opponent's Digimon attack, can I activate my [BT1-082 Rosemon]'s effect before activating this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end that attack?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: Can I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end my opponent's Digimon's attack after the DP comparison from battling?
A: No, as it is already passed the timing of [When your opponent's Digimon attacks] at this point of time after battle, you cannot activate this effect. (See more in Attack Resolution)
Q: After using this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect. Is it treated as that attack never happened?
A: No, the attack happens, and any [When Attacking] and [End of Attack] effects still activate.
Q: If I use this card's effect to trash 2 of this card's Digivolution cards. Can I use [BT2-085 Joe Kido]'s effect?
A: Yes, you can.

Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon and then uses an effect to delete the attacking Digimon before I use the [Opponent's Turn] effect. Can I still use the effect of [BT5-111 Omnimon X-Anti-body] to negate the attack?
A: You can still trash the digivolution cards but there is no attack to negate anymore.
Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon. I have 2 [BT5-111 Omnimon X-Anti-body]. Can I use both of their effects to negate the attack?
A: You can trash the digivolution cards of the second Omnimon X-Anti-body, but there is no longer an attack to negate.
Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon. I have this card and a <Blocker>. Can I use this card's effect first and then suspend the <Blocker> Digimon?
A: You can suspend your <Blocker> Digimon but the attack will not be redirected.

cards.name: Omnimon Zwart Defeat
cards.jpname: オメガモンズワルト DEFEAT
cards.effect1:
[Security] Play this card without battling and without paying its memory cost.
[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Tamers.
[On Deletion] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
ruling: Q: What does this card's [Security] effect of [Without battling] mean exactly?

A: When this card is revealed from a Security Check, a battle between this card and the attacking Digimon does not happen, and this card is Played into the Battle Area by this effect. As a battle did not happen, the attacking Digimon is not deleted even if it has lower DP than this card.
Q: What happens when this card is revealed from a Security Check while my opponent's Digimon still has remaining checks from <Security Attack +X> effect?
A: After this Digimon is played, continue with the remaining checks.
Q: Can I delete my opponent's Digimon that digivolved from Tamer with this card's [When Digivolving] effect?
A: No, you cannot.
Q: If I am affected by "cannot be played by effects", and this card's [Security] effect does not play it. Does the battle still occur?
A: No, it will be sent to the trashed.
